properties.Name: ExperianConsumerPublicRecord
properties.Description: The Experian reported consumer public records.

Columns.Name: ExperianReportNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Experian consumer.

Columns.Name: ReferenceId
Columns.Description: The number that corresponds to where the public record was recorded at the court. For tax liens it often shows the book-page-sequence number; for bankruptcies it would be the Docket number.

Columns.Name: FilingDate
Columns.Description:
The date the judgment was filed on as reported by the court involved.

Civil judgments remain on your credit report 7 years from the filing date.
Chapter 13 bankruptcy will remain in the credit report for 7 years from the filing date.
Chapter 7 bankruptcy remains on the credit report for 10 years from the filing date.
A paid tax lien is deleted 7 years from the filing date.

Columns.Name: CourtName
Columns.Description:
The name of the court in which the public record was filed.

Ex:
Clayton County Magistrate

Columns.Name: PlaintiffName
Columns.Description: The name, company or organization who brought the case against you in a court of law.

Columns.Name: AwardedAmount
Columns.Description: The monetary amount in damages awarded to the plaintiff.

Columns.Name: ExperianPublicRecordTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifies of a Experian Public Record Type.
